alert.note: Alert for Powell (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 3:14PM MST until November 27 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Powell County in west central Montana... * Until 415 PM MST. * At 314 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 18 miles east of Garrison, or 20 miles northeast of Deer Lodge, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 10 and 26. Locations impacted include... Elliston and Avon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
